alert.note: Alert for Karnes; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 11:16PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Karnes and south central Wilson Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1115 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Falls City, or 13 miles northeast of Campbellton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Karnes City, Falls City, Cestohowa, Hobson, Coy City, Paweleville, Deweesville, Pana Maria and Helena. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
